alert.note: Alert for Southern Lake, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 2:18PM CST until February 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 9 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Southern Lake County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 9 PM CST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday morning through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Isolated power outages are possible. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Forecast snow amounts Tuesday night through Thursday night will change. Keep up with the latest forecast and adjust travel plans accordingly.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
